s278: Ten. Zhang Han made an agreement with Chu to surrender, not yet decided, Xiang Yu agreed but then attacked him.
s281: Twenty-three. Attacked Nanyang governor Yi, broke him east of Yangcheng walls.
s288: Eleven. Xiang Yu made an appointment with Zhang Han at Yin Xu, Zhang Han and others had already surrendered, made alliance with him, made Han the King of Yong.
s291: Twenty-four. Surrendered and took Nanyang, enfeoffed its governor Yi.
s294: Fifteen. Shen Yang took Henan, surrendered to Chu.
s296: Eighth month. Zhao Gao killed the Second Emperor.
s298: Twelve. Made Qin surrender Commandant Yi and Vice Chancellor Xin the supreme generals, commanding the Qin surrender army.
s299: Twenty-one. King Xie of Zhao remained in the state. Chen Yu fled and resided at Nanpi.
s311: Twenty-six. Attacked and took Yao and Lantian. Using Liu Hou's strategy, without fighting all surrendered.
s318: Fourteen. Xiang Yu led the feudal lords' troops of more than 400,000, marched and raided territory, west to Henan.
s319: Twenty-three. Zhang Er followed Chu west into Qin.
s321: Twenty-seven. Han year one, Qin prince Ziying surrendered. Duke Pei entered and broke Xianyang, pacified Qin, returned army to Bashang, awaited the feudal lords' agreement.
s323: Fifteen. Followed Xiang Yu raiding territory, then entered the passes.
s328: Fifteen. Yu deceitfully pit-killed 200,000 Qin surrender soldiers at Xin'an.
s331: Twenty-eight. Duke Pei issued three chapter command, Qin people greatly pleased.
